scenes.name: Down the Rabbit Hole
scenes.summary: Alice spots a hurried rabbit and follows it down a deep rabbit hole, beginning her adventures.
scenes.firstLine: Alice was beginning to get very tired of sitting by her sister on the bank, and of having nothing to do.
scenes.lastLine: In another moment down went Alice after it, never once considering how in the world she was to get out again.

characters.name: Alice
characters.quote: what is the use of a book, thought Alice, without pictures or conversation?

characters.name: White Rabbit
characters.quote: Oh dear! Oh dear! I shall be late!

scenes.name: The Pool of Tears
scenes.summary: After growing too large and then too small, Alice cries a pool of tears which she later falls into.
scenes.firstLine: The rabbit-hole went straight on like a tunnel for some way, and then dipped suddenly down.
scenes.lastLine: I wish I hadn't cried so much!

characters.name: Alice
characters.quote: I wish I hadn't cried so much!

scenes.name: A Caucus-Race and a Long Tale
scenes.summary: Alice encounters various creatures who have also been affected by the pool of tears, and they participate in a Caucus-Race to get dry.
scenes.firstLine: The first question was, how to get dry again.
scenes.lastLine: 'I shall do nothing of the sort,' said the Mouse, getting up and walking away.

characters.name: Alice
characters.quote: Oh, I beg your pardon!

characters.name: Mouse
characters.quote: 'I shall do nothing of the sort,' said the Mouse, getting up and walking away.

characters.name: Dodo
characters.quote: 'The best thing to get us dry would be a Caucus-race.'

scenes.name: The Rabbit Sends in a Little Bill
scenes.summary: Alice enters the White Rabbit's house, grows too large, and causes chaos.
scenes.firstLine: It was the White Rabbit, trotting slowly back again, and looking anxiously about as it went, as if it had lost something.
scenes.lastLine: 'And yet what a dear little puppy it was!' said Alice.

characters.name: Alice
characters.quote: 'Oh dear, what nonsense I'm talking!'

characters.name: White Rabbit
characters.quote: 'Oh my ears and whiskers, how late it's getting!'

scenes.name: Advice from a Caterpillar
scenes.summary: Alice meets a caterpillar who gives her advice on changing size and tells her about the mushroom.
scenes.firstLine: The Caterpillar and Alice looked at each other for some time in silence.
scenes.lastLine: 'One side will make you grow taller, and the other side will make you grow shorter.'

characters.name: Alice
characters.quote: 'Who are _you_?' said the Caterpillar.

characters.name: Caterpillar
characters.quote: 'Keep your temper,' said the Caterpillar.

scenes.name: Pig and Pepper
scenes.summary: Alice witnesses the chaos at the Duchess's house, including a baby turning into a pig.
scenes.firstLine: For a minute or two she stood looking at the house, and wondering what to do next.
scenes.lastLine: 'If it had grown up,' she said to herself, 'it would have made a dreadfully ugly child: but it makes rather a handsome pig, I think.'

characters.name: Alice
characters.quote: 'If it had grown up,' she said to herself, 'it would have made a dreadfully ugly child: but it makes rather a handsome pig, I think.'

characters.name: Duchess
characters.quote: The Duchess was sitting on a three-legged stool in the middle, nursing a baby; the cook was leaning over the fire, stirring a large cauldron which seemed to be full of soup.

characters.name: Cheshire Cat
characters.quote: 'It's a Cheshire cat,' said the Duchess, 'and that's why. Pig!'

characters.name: Baby
characters.quote: and the baby was howling so much already, that it was quite impossible to say whether the blows hurt it or not.

scenes.name: A Mad Tea-Party
scenes.summary: Alice encounters the Mad Hatter, the March Hare, and the Dormouse, who are having a never-ending tea party.
scenes.firstLine: There was a table set out under a tree in front of the house, and the March Hare and the Hatter were having tea at it.
scenes.lastLine: 'At any rate I'll never go _there_ again!' said Alice as she picked her way through the wood.

characters.name: Alice
characters.quote: 'This is the stupidest tea party I've ever been to in all my life!'

characters.name: Mad Hatter
characters.quote: 'Why is a raven like a writing-desk?'

characters.name: March Hare
characters.quote: 'Have some wine,' the March Hare said in an encouraging tone.

characters.name: Dormouse
characters.quote: 'I wasn't asleep,' he said in a hoarse, feeble voice: 'I heard every word you fellows were saying.'

scenes.name: The Queen's Croquet Ground
scenes.summary: Alice is introduced to the Queen of Hearts and participates in a croquet game with living equipment.

characters.name: Alice
characters.quote: 'It's—it's a very fine day!' said Alice.

characters.name: Queen of Hearts
characters.quote: 'Off with his head!'

characters.name: King of Hearts
characters.quote: 'Consider, my dear: she is only a child!'

scenes.name: The Mock Turtle's Story
scenes.summary: Alice meets the Mock Turtle and the Gryphon, who share stories about their education under the sea.
scenes.firstLine: 'Come on, then,' said the Queen, 'and he shall tell you his history,'
scenes.lastLine: 'That's the reason they're called lessons,' the Gryphon remarked: 'because they lessen from day to day.'

characters.name: Alice
characters.quote: And how many hours a day did you do lessons?' said Alice, in a hurry to change the subject.

characters.name: Mock Turtle
characters.quote: 'When we were little,' the Mock Turtle went on at last, more calmly, though still sobbing a little now and then, 'we went to school in the sea.'

characters.name: Gryphon
characters.quote: 'That's the reason they're called lessons,' the Gryphon remarked: 'because they lessen from day to day.'

scenes.name: The Lobster Quadrille
scenes.summary: The Mock Turtle and Gryphon perform a dance for Alice, leading into a whimsical explanation of a sea dance.
scenes.firstLine: The Mock Turtle sighed deeply, and drew the back of one flapper across his eyes.
scenes.lastLine: 'Thank you, it's a very interesting dance to watch,' said Alice, feeling very glad that it was over at last.

characters.name: Alice
characters.quote: 'Thank you, it's a very interesting dance to watch,' said Alice, feeling very glad that it was over at last.

characters.name: Mock Turtle
characters.quote: 'You may not have lived much under the sea—' ('I haven't,' said Alice)—'and perhaps you were never even introduced to a lobster—' (Alice began to say 'I once tasted—' but checked herself hastily).

characters.name: Gryphon
characters.quote: 'Will you, won't you, will you, won't you, will you join the dance?'

scenes.name: Who Stole the Tarts?
scenes.summary: Alice attends a trial where the Knave of Hearts is accused of stealing the Queen's tarts.
scenes.firstLine: The King and Queen of Hearts were seated on their throne when they arrived, with a great crowd assembled about them.
scenes.lastLine: 'Call the first witness,' said the King; and the White Rabbit blew three blasts on the trumpet.

characters.name: Alice
characters.quote: Alice had never been in a court of justice before, but she had read about them in books, and she was quite pleased to find that she knew the name of nearly everything there.

characters.name: Queen of Hearts
characters.quote: 'Silence!' screamed the Queen. 'Off with his head! Off—'

characters.name: King of Hearts
characters.quote: '—and just take his head off outside,' the Queen added to one of the officers: but the White Rabbit interrupted, 'Unimportant, your Majesty means, of course,' he said in a very respectful tone, but frowning and making faces at him as he spoke.'

characters.name: Knave of Hearts
characters.quote: The Knave shook his head sadly. 'Do I look like it?' he said. (Which he certainly did NOT, being made entirely of cardboard.)

scenes.name: Alice's Evidence
scenes.summary: Alice is called to the stand at the trial, but her growing confusion and size disrupt the proceedings.
scenes.firstLine: 'Here!' cried Alice, quite forgetting in the flurry of the moment how large she had grown in the last few minutes.
scenes.lastLine: 'Who cares for you?' said Alice, (she had grown to her full size by this time.) 'You're nothing but a pack of cards!'

characters.name: Alice
characters.quote: 'Who cares for you?' said Alice, 'You're nothing but a pack of cards!'

characters.name: Queen of Hearts
characters.quote: 'Silence!' screamed the Queen.

characters.name: King of Hearts
characters.quote: 'Consider your verdict,' the King said to the jury.

characters.name: Jury
characters.quote: The jury all wrote down on their slates, 'She doesn't believe there's an atom of meaning in it.'

locations.name: The Rabbit Hole
locations.quote: In another moment down went Alice after it, never once considering how in the world she was to get out again.

locations.name: The Pool of Tears
locations.quote: However, she soon made out that she was in the pool of tears which she had wept when she was nine feet high.

locations.name: The Garden
locations.quote: Alice opened the door and found that it led into a small passage, not much larger than a rat-hole: she knelt down and looked along the passage into the loveliest garden you ever saw.

locations.name: The Duchess's Kitchen
locations.quote: The door led right into a large kitchen, which was full of smoke from one end to the other: the Duchess was sitting on a three-legged stool in the middle, nursing a baby.

locations.name: The March Hare's House
locations.quote: There was a table set out under a tree in front of the house, and the March Hare and the Hatter were having tea at it.

locations.name: The Queen's Croquet Ground
locations.quote: The Queen's Croquet-Ground was a very curious sight.

characters.quote: Alice was beginning to get very tired of sitting by her sister on the bank, and of having nothing to do.
characters.explanation: A serene sky blue, reflecting Alice's curiosity and her journey through the whimsical world.

characters.quote: suddenly a White Rabbit with pink eyes ran close by her.
characters.explanation: A soft, warm off-white with a hint of pink, mirroring the rabbit's fur and pink eyes.

characters.quote: 'Mine is a long and sad tale!' said the Mouse.
characters.explanation: A neutral gray, reflecting the Mouse's role as a more subdued character, and its actual color as a mouse.

characters.quote: 'The best way to explain it is to do it.'
characters.explanation: An earthy yellow, suggesting the Dodo's quirky and outdated existence.

characters.quote: 'If it had grown up,' she said to herself, 'it would have made a dreadfully ugly child: but it makes rather a handsome pig, I think.'
characters.explanation: A soft pink, indicative of infancy and innocence, and echoing Alice's remark about it becoming a pig.

characters.quote: The Duchess was sitting on a three-legged stool in the middle, nursing a baby.
characters.explanation: A deep purple, connoting royalty and authority but with a whimsical twist.

characters.quote: 'It's a Cheshire cat,' said the Duchess, 'and that's why. Pig!'
characters.explanation: A vibrant, mystical pink, embodying the cat's enigmatic and mischievous nature.

characters.quote: 'Who are _you_?' said the Caterpillar.
characters.explanation: A deep indigo, representing the Caterpillar's mysterious and contemplative nature.

characters.quote: 'Have some wine,' the March Hare said in an encouraging tone.
characters.explanation: A golden brown, reflecting the hare's energetic and slightly mad personality.

characters.quote: 'Your hair wants cutting,' said the Hatter.
characters.explanation: A rich, dark brown, echoing the Hatter's tea-stained attire and eccentric personality.

characters.quote: 'I wasn't asleep,' he said in a hoarse, feeble voice: 'I heard every word you fellows were saying.'
characters.explanation: A lighter, warm brown, capturing the Dormouse's sleepy disposition and its cozy, fur-like appearance.

characters.quote: 'Off with his head!' she said, without even looking round.
characters.explanation: A bold, striking red, symbolizing the Queen's fiery temper and the theme of hearts running through her domain.

characters.quote: 'Consider my dear: she is only a child!' the King said.
characters.explanation: A royal gold, highlighting the King's authority but also his more amiable and less imposing nature compared to the Queen.

characters.quote: 'Will you, won't you, will you, won't you, will you join the dance?'
characters.explanation: A vivid orange, reflective of the Gryphon's bold and somewhat flamboyant role in guiding Alice.

characters.quote: 'When we were little,' the Mock Turtle went on at last, more calmly, though still sobbing a little now and then, 'we went to school in the sea.'
characters.explanation: A sea blue, nodding to the Mock Turtle's oceanic origins and his melancholic, reflective tales of the sea.

characters.quote: 'I haven't done anything wrong,' said the Knave of Hearts, 'and I don't deserve to be punished.'
characters.explanation: A light, soft red, echoing the theme of hearts but in a more subdued, innocent manner.

characters.quote: The jury all wrote down on their slates, 'She doesn't believe there's an atom of meaning in it.'
characters.explanation: A cool, slate gray, suggesting the impersonal and detached role of the jury in the story.
